page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area is situated to the north of Bury town centre in Lancashire. The block consists of industrial, residential and farming landuse. Dissecting the area is the {M66 motorway}which links Manchester with the Rossendale valley. Major utilities in the area include the Borough fire and ambulance stations, at present part of Greater Manchester Council, and two major hospitals.{Housing}consists of brick terraced, and two large 1920s council estates, with newer private housing to the north of the block. {Culturally}the area now has a strong Pakistani community and also a site for travelling people. The industrial base is a mixture of new estate units and established firms such as Barker & Dobson.{(Toffees!).
